poem:
A Legacy Remembered

In sepia tones, the stories sleep,  
hoisting silk saris and khaki hats  
into the bloom of history's pages.  
Let grandchildren sip these tales,  
the brave crossing oceans of dust  
to stand firm in foreign sands.  
Whispers of valor weave dusk  
with the dawn of understanding.  
Speak their names,  
and let the echoes endure.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. The My Family Legacy project, backed by the Royal British Legion, is building an online archive of Asian veterans’ experiences". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
